item.title: Monday add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Political language is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable, and to give an appearance of solidity to pure wind. " -- George Orwell

item.title: Monday add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "I have written a wicked book, and feel spotless as the lamb." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Monday add a quote by Simon Reynolds
item.description: "Is nostalgia stopping our cultureâ€™s ability to surge forward, or are we nostalgic precisely because our culture has stopped moving forward and so we inevitably look back to more momentous and dynamic times?" -- Simon Reynolds

item.title: Monday add a quote by Simon Reynolds
item.description: "Not only has there never before been a society so obsessed with the cultural artifacts of its immediate past, but there has never before been a society that is able to access the immediate past so easily and so copiously." -- Simon Reynolds
